item.title: 议员称日本应在美国帮助下应对中国威胁
item.description: 一位直言不讳的日本立法者表示，日本应利用与美国的同盟关系来应对中国的威胁，而不是独自寻求会导致长期损失的快速妥协，这位立法者已被禁止进入中国。【原文：Japan should leverage its alliance with the US to counter China’s threats rather than seeking quick compromises alone that will lead to long-term losses, according to an outspoken Japanese lawmaker whose entry into China has been banned.】

item.title: 鲨鱼宝宝 "创作者62%的亏损使股价跌破IPO价格
item.description: 病毒式儿童歌曲 "鲨鱼宝宝 "背后的公司在上市几天后，股价就跌破了首次公开募股的价格，这股热潮也随之消退。【原文：The frenzy for the company behind the viral children’s hit “Baby Shark” has all but fizzled after shares slid below their IPO price just days after debuting.】

item.title: GfK 信心调查的每个部分都对英国预算感到不安
item.description: 在工党政府下周发布预算案之前，一项受到密切关注的英国消费者信心指数在各项指标上都有所下降，预计工党政府将在预算案中提高税收。【原文：A closely-watched index of consumer confidence in the UK has fallen on every measure ahead of the Labour’s government’s budget next week, at which it is expected to raise taxes.】

item.title: 研究发现：英国脱欧对英国经济的打击是官方估计的两倍
item.description: 包括英格兰银行高级经济学家在内的一批专家发表的新论文称，英国脱欧对英国经济造成的损害几乎是官方预测的两倍。【原文：Brexit has caused almost twice as much damage to the UK economy than estimated by official forecasts, according to new paper from a group of experts including a senior Bank of England economist.】

item.title: 新加坡在经济放缓前将 2025 年国内生产总值展望上调至 4
item.description: 在第三季度经济增长好于预期之后，新加坡将今年的经济增长预期提高了一倍，达到4%左右，但由于美国关税对全球经济的冲击，新加坡认为明年的经济活动将放缓。【原文：Singapore roughly doubled its outlook for economic growth this year to around 4%, after a better than expected third-quarter, but sees activity slowing next year as US tariffs hit the global economy.】

item.title: 韩国早期贸易数据显示出口势头不减
item.description: 尽管美国对汽车征收的高额关税削弱了贸易势头，但受半导体需求持续增长的支撑，韩国 11 月份的早期出口继续增长。【原文：South Korea’s early exports continued to grow in November, supported by sustained demand for semiconductors even as steep US tariffs on autos weighed on trade momentum.】

item.title: 日本称若日元过度波动可选择外汇干预措施
item.description: 日本就日元的急剧波动向外汇市场发出了迄今为止最强烈的警告，日本财政大臣特别提到了干预是一种选择，她正试图抵制日元的持续下跌。【原文：Japan issued its strongest warning yet to foreign exchange markets over sharp movements in the yen, with the nation’s finance minister specifically mentioning intervention as an option as she tries to push back against continued falls in the currency.】

item.title: 美联储主席保尔森表示对 12 月利率决定持谨慎态度
item.description: 费城联邦储备银行行长安娜-保尔森（Anna Paulson）表示，她将以谨慎的态度对待下个月的利率制定会议，尽管她仍然更担心就业市场的疲软。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Philadelphia President Anna Paulson said she’s approaching next month’s rate-setting meeting with caution, though she remains more concerned about weaknesses in the job market.】

item.title: 美国股市下跌后，韩国 Kospi 指数下跌超过 4
item.description: 由于对人工智能相关估值捉襟见肘的担忧加剧，科技股再度下挫，韩国股票基准在开盘时暴跌达 4.2%。【原文：South Korea’s stock benchmark tumbled as much as 4.2% at the open, as tech-heavy selloffs resumed on mounting concerns over stretched AI-related valuations.】

item.title: 美国就业数据令降息前景黯淡，黄金保持稳定
item.description: 美国就业报告喜忧参半，几乎没有为美联储降息提供新的动力，因此黄金持稳。【原文：Gold was steady after a mixed US jobs report that offered little fresh incentive for the Federal Reserve to cut interest rates.】

item.title: 高市准备采取价格措施，日本通胀回升
item.description: 日本通胀率在 10 月份略有上升，这使得日本央行在未来几个月内继续保持加息的势头，因为首相高市真奈正在准备一揽子经济计划，以平息公众对生活成本上升的不满。【原文：Japan’s inflation ticked higher in October, keeping the Bank of Japan on track for an interest rate hike in coming months as Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi prepares an economic package that aims to soothe public discontent over rising costs of living.】

item.title: Netflix、康卡斯特和派拉蒙出价收购华纳：纽约时报
item.description: 纽约时报》援引四位知情人士的话报道称，Netflix 公司、康卡斯特公司和派拉蒙天舞公司都提交了对华纳兄弟 Discovery 公司的竞标书。【原文：Netflix Inc., Comcast Corp. and Paramount Skydance Corp. all submitted bids for Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., the New York Times reported, citing four people with knowledge of the proposals.】

item.title: 瑞银集团称，私人信贷违约预计将在 2026 年引发压力
item.description: 随着越来越多的借款人努力应对通货膨胀、利息成本上升和消费者疲软的影响，预计明年的信贷压力将上升。但私人信贷可能是最糟糕的。【原文：Credit stress is expected to rise next year as more borrowers grapple with the effects of inflation, higher interest costs and a weakening consumer. But private credit might see the worst of it.】

item.title: 石油因乌克兰和平计划而下跌，俄罗斯制裁即将开始
item.description: 乌克兰总统沃洛德梅尔-泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskiy）同意制定一项和平计划后，石油走低，而此时美国对两家俄罗斯石油巨头的制裁正计划于周五生效。【原文：Oil pushed lower after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy agreed to work on a peace plan, just as US sanctions on two Russian oil giants are scheduled to take effect on Friday.】

item.title: Fibra Next 据称将通过缩减股票出售规模筹资 4 亿美元
item.description: 墨西哥房地产投资信托公司 Nearshoring Experts & Technology SC 通过出售股份筹集了约 4 亿美元，低于目标金额。【原文：Mexican real estate investment trust Nearshoring Experts & Technology SC raised around $400 million in a share sale, below the targeted amount, after international interest in the deal dried up at the last moment, according to people familiar with the transaction.】

item.title: 债券交易员探究日本收益率曲线腰部疲软原因
item.description: 债券交易员们正围着日本首相佐那江隆一的经济刺激计划转，随时准备在支出膨胀时出手。【原文：Bond traders are circling Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s economic stimulus package, ready to pounce as spending swells.】

item.title: 墨西哥金融科技公司签署 5000 万美元信贷额度协议，促进小额贷款发展
item.description: 墨西哥金融科技公司 Aviva 从总部位于旧金山的社区投资管理公司（Community Investment Management）获得了 5000 万美元的信用贷款，在拉丁美洲风险资本交易徘徊在七年低点附近之际，该公司正努力扩大贷款规模。【原文：Mexican fintech Aviva secured a $50 million credit facility from San Francisco-based Community Investment Management as it seeks to expand lending at a time when venture capital dealmaking in Latin America is hovering near seven-year lows.】

item.title: 金融亿万富翁警告私人信贷市场风险上升
item.description: 金融业的亿万富翁们对他们所认为的资产估值急剧上升、有限的监管和宏观经济压力所导致的私人市场风险增加表示担忧。【原文：Finance industry billionaires are raising concerns over what they see as increasing risk in private markets fueled by steep rises in asset valuations, limited regulation and macroeconomic pressures.】

item.title: 乳业大亨押注东南亚下一轮增长
item.description: 马来西亚最大的乳制品生产商 Farm Fresh Bhd. 正加大在东南亚的扩张力度，以在该地区超过 5 亿的消费者中分得更大一杯羹。【原文：Malaysia’s largest dairy producer Farm Fresh Bhd. is stepping up its expansion across Southeast Asia to grab a bigger slice of the region’s more than half a billion consumers.】

item.title: 高盛在出售芝加哥国债后留下 7500 万美元债务
item.description: 本周三，高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：Goldman Sachs Group Inc. took down a portion of a $454 million debt deal from Chicago on Wednesday even after boosting yields on the sales-tax bonds that hold higher ratings than the city.】

item.title: OpenAI 与富士康合作为数据中心设计硬件
item.description: OpenAI 正在与鸿海精密工业股份有限公司合作设计和制造数据中心硬件，这是该乐虎国际_乐虎国际app_乐虎国际APP下载_乐虎国际手机客户端为满足其对支持人工智能系统的基础设施日益增长的需求而采取的最新举措。【原文：OpenAI is partnering with Hon Hai Precision Industry Co. to design and manufacture hardware for data centers, the latest move by the ChatGPT maker to meet its surging need for infrastructure to support artificial intelligence systems.】

item.title: 华尔街涨势消退后股市将走弱：市场综述
item.description: 华尔街出现动荡，英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.）引领的短暂救市反弹迅速消退，投资者从加密货币等风险较高的资产上撤出，股市在此之后又将迎来一个疲软的交易日。【原文：Equities were poised for another weak session after turbulence on Wall Street, where a brief Nvidia Corp.-led relief rally quickly faded and investors retreated from riskier assets such as cryptocurrencies.】

item.title: 英国计划投资 100 亿英镑建设威尔士数据中心枢纽，推动人工智能发展
item.description: 英国计划在威尔士南部建立一个数据中心园区，开发商 Vantage Data Centers 将斥资 100 亿英镑（131 亿美元）在微软公司所在地附近建造设施。【原文：The UK plans to open a data center campus in south Wales, with developer Vantage Data Centers spending £10 billion ($13.1 billion) for facilities near a Microsoft Corp. site.】

item.title: 高盛洪水认为 "极端 "关注套期保值是股市下跌的驱动力
item.description: 高盛（Goldman Sachs）合伙人约翰-弗拉德（John Flood）表示，周四美股的大幅反转凸显了英伟达公司（Nvidia Corp.【原文：A dramatic reversal in US stocks Thursday underscored how Nvidia Corp.’s blowout earnings failed to deliver the “all clear” for risk that traders sought, instead sending them for cover against further losses, Goldman Sachs’ partner John Flood said.】

item.title: 德意志银行警告日本资本外逃与英国危机如出一辙
item.description: 德意志银行（Deutsche Bank AG）全球货币研究主管表示，真荣孝一的支出计划已导致日本债券和货币暴跌，引发了不规则资本外逃的幽灵，让人联想起 2022 年几乎摧毁英国债券市场的动荡。【原文：Sanae Takaichi’s spending plans have sent Japan’s bonds and currency tumbling, raising the specter of an unruly capital flight reminiscent of the turmoil that nearly broke the UK bond market in 2022, according to Deutsche Bank AG’s global head of currency research.】

item.title: 日本决策者对日元措辞的交易指南
item.description: 日元对美元汇率 10 个月来首次突破 157 点，这可能会助长人们的猜测，即日本可能不得不考虑自 2024 年 7 月以来首次采取行动支撑本国货币。【原文：The yen’s breaching of the 157 level against the dollar for the first time in 10 months is likely to fuel speculation that Japan may have to consider taking action to prop up its currency for the first time since July 2024.】

item.title: 跳跃交易悄然加入事件投注热潮，成为做市商
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Jump Trading 已悄然成为最早活跃在 Kalshi Inc.等预测市场的自营交易公司之一，并向最热门的新兴衍生品市场拓展。【原文：Jump Trading has quietly become one of the earliest proprietary trading firms to become active on prediction markets like Kalshi Inc., expanding into one of the hottest new derivatives markets, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Asurion 接近达成 CVC 支持的国内印花厂交易；通用汽车
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，Asurion LLC 正在就收购 Domestic & General Group Ltd. 进行深入谈判，该交易对英国保修业务的估值为 21 亿英镑（27.4 亿美元）。【原文：Asurion LLC is in advanced talks to acquire Domestic & General Group Ltd. in a deal valuing the UK warranty business at £2.1 billion ($2.74 billion), according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: Meta 董事会以 1.9 亿美元解决投资者的隐私索赔问题
item.description: 法院文件显示，亿万富翁马克-扎克伯格（Mark Zuckerberg）和 Meta Platforms Inc.【原文：Billionaire Mark Zuckerberg and other Meta Platforms Inc. directors agreed to a $190 million settlement of claims they failed to rectify repeated violations of Facebook users’ privacy and improperly engineered an accord to protect Zuckerberg from personal liability for the privacy missteps, court filings show.】

item.title: 美国新任大使抨击智利总统批评特朗普
item.description: 智利总统加布里埃尔-博里奇（Gabriel Boric）最近对唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）的批评 "令人失望"，表明双边关系 "已经跌到了何种地步"，这位新到任的美国大使在其首次新闻发布会上如是说。【原文：Chilean President Gabriel Boric’s recent criticism of Donald Trump was “disappointing” and shows how far bilateral relations “have fallen,” the newly arrived US ambassador said at his first press conference.】
